intro: Euphorbia goliana, commonly known as the Golian spurge, is a succulent plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster called a cyathium, which is typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to store water in its stems. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
